definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: I hate to see you standing about by youself in this stupid manner.
sentences.chinese: 我可不愿意看到你独个儿这么傻里傻气的站在这。

sentences.english: RS: Yeah, I think the kind of goofiness.
sentences.chinese: 有啊，我想是那种傻气吧。

sentences.english: He laughed a little to himself at his own foolishness.
My 21 years ago, are seemingly foolish to take the blind live.
sentences.chinese: 我的前21年貌似都在冒傻气的瞎活。

sentences.english: He looks stupid standing there gazing at her.
sentences.chinese: 他站在那里盯着她看，显得傻里傻气。

sentences.english: At last, a group of people naively offer themselves for the job.
sentences.chinese: 终于来了，一群傻里傻气的志愿者。

sentences.english: The silly young man was prating about a subject of which he knew nothing.
sentences.chinese: 那个傻里傻气的年轻人在胡扯他一无所知的问题。

sentences.english: He kept on bothering me with silly questions that I told him to go fly a kite.
sentences.chinese: 他尽用些傻里傻气的问题来烦我，故此我叫他滚开。

sentences.english: Ask me another, Jim. Well, I suppose so.
sentences.chinese: 别傻里傻气了，吉姆，唔，我想大概喜欢吧。

sentences.english: To her, I'm an easy-going, dim-witted foreigner.
sentences.chinese: 对她来说，我很平易近人，是个有点傻气的外国人。

sentences.english: I hate to see you standing about by yourself in this stupid manner.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿看到你独个儿这么傻里傻气地站在这儿。

sentences.english: This part of my life is called"Internship".
sentences.chinese: 就像我说的，我人生的这部分叫做“冒傻气”。

sentences.english: Adding laughter and silliness to your life will be a game changer.
sentences.chinese: 在你生活里加入爆笑点和傻气能改变你的游戏。

sentences.english: Because I had behaved stupidly the previous evening.
sentences.chinese: 因为前一天晚上我有点傻里傻气。

sentences.english: I would be sillier than I have been this trip.
sentences.chinese: 我会过的比这一次旅程更加傻气。

definition: to be foolish/to play dumb/to gaze absentmindedly
